CatDescriptText: Helene Weiss, sales clerk, 20201 Mt. Troy Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that racial prejudice is inherent or is it taught to children? If you believe that it is taught do you think that the teaching of it is increasing or diminishing?  If so, by whom do you think that it is taught?" answer reads: "I say that they are taught by their parents.  I think, however, that it is decreasing and the reason is because of education."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Helene Weiss wearing floral sleeveless button down shirt, hands behind back, standing in front of store window with two rectangular signs
